body:
This seems like a usability issue, rather than a bug. Although the _sanitize_globals() function is sort of odd. It attempts to unset the _GET _POST and _COOKIE keys that are in the global namespace, but it leaves the _REQUEST variable alone. So basically you can still access an invalid cookie key using _REQUEST['_COOKIE'][$key].

Nevertheless, a user can extend the Input library and create their own version of the _clean_input_keys() method to allow the extended characters.

issue.title: fixing cookie problem : issues #33

issue.title: Bug report: 'disallowed key characters' error message - CodeIgniter (OU Library)

repository.name: open-media-player
repository.description: A mainstream audio & video player service that puts accessibility first â€”

issue.body:
This bug has been reported by University staff members, via the Library, and seems to occur when cookies are set on the Player's domain (eg. `mediaplayer.open.ac.uk`), probably by a third-party library (Google Analytics?), that contain characters that CodeIgniter thinks are a security risk.
- [Stackoverflow: disallowed-key-characters-codeigniter-urgent](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26145721/disallowed-key-characters-codeigniter-urgent) -- Google? `__utmt_~1` 
- https://ellislab.com/forums/viewthread/235259/#1069295
